title: Jan Blažek
text:
Jan Blažek (born 20 March 1988) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who is currently plays for <a href="FK%20Litom%C4%9B%C5%99icko">FK Litoměřicko</a>.
Blažek is known as a very talented as well as a somewhat controversial player, due to his conflicts with coaches and alcohol consumption. On his web site he stated his motto: "Děvky, chlast a prcání" (hookers, booze and fucking). The site also included many photographs of him drinking rum with cola. After Blažek's transfer to Slavia, the web site gained some attention of the media, resulting in motto being changed to "věř v sám sebe" (trust in yourself) and the controversial photographs were removed.
In July 2011 Blažek returned to his mother club <a href="FC%20Slovan%20Liberec">FC Slovan Liberec</a>. On 24 July 2012, Blažek scored a goal against <a href="Kazakhstan">Kazakhstan</a>i club <a href="FC%20Shakhter%20Karagandy">Shakhter Karagandy</a> at the very end of the period of <a href="extra%20time">extra time</a> to level the result at 1–1 and enable his team to progress to the next round of the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> by an aggregate score of 2–1. He spent time at Greek second division side <a href="Aiginiakos%20F.C.">Aiginiakos</a> in the autumn part of the 2014–15 season, before joining <a href="FK%20Dukla%20Prague">FK Dukla Prague</a> on loan in February 2015.
International career.
On 15 November 2009, Blažek made his first appearance for the national team in a friendly game against United Arab Emirates.
